data.notes: 13 security agents working in the gas site managed by Perenco, in desert of Douz, started a four-day strike to demand better pay.
Three al-Shabab fighters have been killed after military forces attacked an al-Shabab base in the outskirts of central town Beledweyne. Among the dead include a commander known as Abdi Aden.

The Petroleum Facilities Guard (PFG) said one of its fighters was killed after being shot as he was driving a car with another PFG fighter. They claimed that the car came under heavy fire opened by the illegitimate gangs of Dignity Operation, according to the statement, leading to the death of one fighter and the injury of the other, while a third fighter who was in the clashes area was kidnapped and efforts are underway to release him.

data.actor2: Military Forces of the United States
data.notes: US warplanes alongside the Operation Solid Structure's air force struck IS locations in Sirte on 13 August.

data.actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Presidential Guard
data.notes: Operation Bunyan Marsous forces overran the radio station in Sirte and retake it from IS control.
The armys 153 Infantry Brigade moved into Zuetina but stopped short of entering the oil terminal which is controlled by the Petroleum Facilities Guard headed by Ibrahim Jadhran.

IS claimed that it had hit an army assembly point in Gwarsha with artillery and heavy-machine gun fire. They said that their counter attack had forced the soldiers to withdraw. It was not possible to obtain a comment on the firefight from the army.
People protested against the government agenda in Debre Markos. Soldiers allegedly shot at protesters to disperse them.
A group of activists and MPs staged a protest at Dar al-Qadaa al-Ali, a prominent judicial institution in downtown Cairo, on 13 August against sectarian violence in Minya governorate.

After a young man died under uncertain circumstances, but allegedly murdered by an MP of the Paoua area, angry residents attacked the MPs home, looted it and torched vehicles. Religious leaders intervened to calm the protesters. The MP took refuge in the MINUSCA base in the city.
Teachers protested in Beja.

data.actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
data.notes: Government and SPLA-IO forces clashed between Rejaf East and Lobonok southeast of Juba. An SPLA-IO spokesman claimed the government had attacked them, and that 15 government soldiers were killed during the clash. 4 military trucks were also destroyed.

The shooting of a suspected poacher by rangers in South Africa's biggest wildlife park set off protests by villagers living nearby. residents of the village of the suspected poacher had used stones, branches and burning tires to block a road 12 miles.
Local government official has been shot and killed by men armed with pistols in Shibis.
Al Shabaab attacks a police station in Afgooye, engage in battle. No reports of causalities.
No fewer than seven persons were feared dead in Akokwa community in Ideato North council of Imo State, following a bloody clash between the Hausa/Fulani community and the indigenes of Akokwa.

RENAMO gunmen attacked the town of Morrumbala in Zambezia province, vandalising and setting the health centre on fire, damaging the home of the district administrator, setting fire to a police vehicle and freeing prisoners from the police cells. No exchange of gunfire or casualties reported.

RENAMO gunmen ambushed a team of Radio Mozambique and TVM journalists in Chiuala, Barue district in Manica province, firing on their cars, leaving one occupant injured. The journalists were travelling to Macossa to cover the President's forthcoming visit to the district.

Between four and six civilians, including two children, were reported to have been killed in a Benghazi airstrike on 12 August in Ganfouda, which the Benghazi Defence Brigade (BDB) are blaming on a French drone. This was not confirmed. The family are said to be from sub-Saharan Africa.
Employees of the Bahir Dar regional health office have refused to go to work, demanding the release of arrested people in the context of regional protests against the government agenda.
A man was killed by unidentified armed men in Debre Markos in the context of planned protests against the government agenda.

data.actor1: Dibaya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
data.actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
data.notes: 11 policemen and 8 members of Kamwina Nsapu's militia, including the leader himself, were killed in a clash with police in the Tshimbulu area which was allegedly started by Nsapu's militia. 4 other police are missing, while 40 militiamen were captured during the fighting.

data.actor1: Okolongo Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
data.actor2: Okolongo Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
data.notes: 7 people were killed and 60 houses burnt in a clash between two rival camps of the ruling family in the villages of Okitodimba and Lotelama in the Okolongo sector of Sankuru.

Two caches containing 13 homemade guns, 8 bombs, 10kg of explosives and detonation means were discovered and destroyed by a detachment of the People's National Army (ANP) during a combing operation at Sidi Ali Bounab forest located in the province of Boumerdes.
A group of young people from Adrar have blocked access to a gas site near Adrar for six days, preventing local workers from accessing or quitting the premises.

Scores of people yesterday gathered at the African Unity Square demanding the return of missing activist, Itai Dzamara, with his wife, Sheffra, making an impassioned plea to the government to release him

A group of 15 PF cadres from Lusaka raided and fired live ammunition into the house of an independent candidate. The police apprehended and arrested the gang, finding them in possession of handguns, machetes, and planks. No injuries reported.

People in Mbarara protested against the government, notably calling for the dismissal of Genral Tumukunde involved in allegations of violence against opposition FDC party supporters. Police intervened to block the demonstration and arrested 8 protesters.
Police in the delegation of Siliana Sud staged a protest movement in the morning of Thursday to denounce increasing insecurity.
Journalists and employees staged a sit-in in the offices of Radio Kelma in Tunis.
A man was stabbed by alleged Islamists near Jebel Selloum after refusing to point the house of security officer.
A protest was organised in front of the governorate of Sfax by residents of Laachech to demand the creation of an ad-hoc municipality.
Several local youths angered by the demolition of an activist's house clashed with the police. Many injuries were reported.

Security forces demolished the house of an activist who opposes the construction of a dam in the Khartoum area. The police tear gassed the family when they resisted, before removing them from the area. No injuries were reported.
Sudanese airforce bombings destroyed an Arab nomadic settlement in the Fanaga area of Jebel Marra. No casualties were reported but livestock were killed.
Citizens of Maridi county have accused the government of air attacks on their area between Aug.10-11. A resident of Maridi town claimed many people were killed or wounded in the area (coded as 10).
A UNHCR carrying food for refugees in Lasu was ambushed by armed men and looted in Yei.
A couple, including a prospective ANC councillor, was killed in their home in Mayamuleni, Tsolo.

data.ally_actor_1: CEPPWAWU: Chemical Energy Paper Printing Wood and Allied Workers Union
data.notes: A handful of Ceppwawu workers picketed outside the Sasol refinery in Alberton.

About 50 residents of informal settlements in Mfuleni protested, blocking streets with burning tyres and garbage. They are furious that their ward councillor, Themba Honono (ANC), has not helped them get an electricity connection.

Approximately 100 Telkom workers with the Communications Workers Union (CWU) marched from Keizersgracht Street to the telephone companys Cape Town offices today to hand over a memorandum demanding a wage increase

Protesters, unhappy over service delivery, were trying to burn down the municipalitys building in Refilwe, Cullinan. Angry locals had tried to torch police Nyala vehicles with petrol bombs and thre rocks.
A group of residents representing the independents and the IFP protested in the main road through Inanda, wit the aim of having the electoral results scrapped.

Students in Libode near Port St Johns burnt down classrooms and two storerooms, and removed taps from water tanks at Mhlanganisweni Technical & Commercial High School yesterday. They were protesting against the Eastern Cape Department of Education.

data.actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
data.notes: Al Shabaab launches an attack on AMISOM and SNG forces in Hudur on 11/08. At least three SNG soldiers reported killed.

Unidentified attackers threw a grenade on a vehicle carrying security force in Dharkenly. The attack has left at least five people, including two security guards wounded. Several suspects were appended the following day.
After a police officer and a meat seller are shot during an argument, a group gathers to protest the violence.
Unknown gun men said to be numbering about four have killed a lecturer with the University of Mkar. It is speculated the attack is politically motivated.
Villagers of Ugborodo staged a three days of protests outside a Chevron facility in Escravos to seek better jobs.
Ex-pat Turkish citizens protest in Abuja against their country's coup attempt, calling for support of President Erdogan.
Two foreign workers were killed and another wounded in a drone strike on their residence in Ganfouda late on 11 August.

data.actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Presidential Guard
data.notes: Pro-government forces battled Thursday to clear the Islamic State group from its main Libyan stronghold of Sirte. Nine pro-GNA fighters were wounded on Thursday and taken to a hospital in Misrata.
To mark the fifth anniversary of their expulsion from their home town by Misratan forces, Tawerghan refugees demonstrated on 11 August in Tripoli and Benghazi.

data.admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
data.notes: To mark the fifth anniversary of their expulsion from their home town by Misratan forces, Tawerghan refugees demonstrated on 11 August in Tripoli and Benghazi.

Clashes were renewed in Minya's town of Samalut on Thursday. According to Copts Today website, three people were arrested and three others are wanted in the village of Abadeya El-Sherei following sectarian clashes. The incident was reported to have begun as a dispute between a Muslim and a Coptic man regarding the ownership of a piece of land. The incident escalated as a fight erupted during a reconciliation session.

data.actor2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
data.notes: The commander of the FDLR-FOCA was captured by FARDC at Katiru in Rutshuru territory.

Residents of Kashusha barricaded the main road leading to the Kavumu airport to protest the killing of 3 people during a robbery the day before, and a growing sense of insecurity in the area due to banditry.

data.ally_actor_1: CDAIP: Coordination of Defense Committees and Deepening the Gains of the Popular Uprising
data.notes: Nearly 300 traders in the 3rd quarter of Ouagadougou held a sit-in and "faced off" with police who were ordered to "interrupt" the protest. Eventually, the mayor agreed to receive leaders for negotiations.
Residents of Oued El Abtal blocked the national route with stones and burning tyres to protest repeated interruptions in water supplies.
A group of young people from Adrar have blocked access to a gas site near Adrar for six days, preventing local workers from accessing or quitting the premises.

Supporters of Inspector General of Police, Gen Kale Kayihura, stormed the Makindye Court in Kampala to disrupt the proceedings against the General on charges of torture against civilians on. They allegedly locked the Court's offices, and threatened the lawyers prosecuting the case, pelting stones at one of them and vandalizing his car. Police interevened to take the lawyers to safety.

A group of Christians and their parish priest blocked the construction of a trench dug up by a road construction firm on the church land along Bwankosa road in Kabale, vandalizing the culverts holding the drainage channel. Police intervened to call for negotiations between the parties.
Merchants of the Lagawa market protested and began a strike over a blockade by the security forces on Nuba Mountain trade.
A female journalist was detained by police and assaulted/beaten during an interrogation.
Citizens of Maridi county have accused the government of air attacks on their area between Aug.10-11. A resident of Maridi town claimed many people were killed or wounded in the area (coded as 10).
Police fired at striking workers who were protesting peacefully outside Hendrina Power station in South Africa's eastern Mpumalanga Provine, injuring several of them.
In Hout Bay, Wynberg taxi drivers went on strike and blocked the road in protest, causing heavy traffic, road closures and inconvenience to commuters.
A prominent elder is assassinated in Hodan on 10/08. Perpetrators not known.
Al Shabaab militants claim to have killed at least 10 soldiers after an attack on Somali military base located in the outskirts of Afgoye town in Lower Shabelle region Wednesday night.

data.actor1: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
data.notes: Members of NDGJM blow up a pipeline in the Delta region.
Villagers of Ugborodo staged a three days of protests outside a Chevron facility in Escravos to seek better jobs.
Electrical workers protest over alleged anti-labour practices.

data.actor2: Military Forces of the United States
data.notes: US Africa Command (Africom) are reported to have carried out airstrikes on IS positions in Sirte on 9 and 10 August, although there has been no official announcement.

data.actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Presidential Guard
data.source: Libya Herald; Deutsche Welle (Bonn); Agence France Presse
data.notes: The Bunyan Marsous Operations Room took control of the Ouagadougou Centre, Ibn Sina Hospital and the university in Sirte, used Islamic State (IS). A Libyan fighter plane was lost during the offensive, killing the pilot and co-pilot. It is not known if it was shot down or crashed because of technical problems. IS, however, have claimed to have brought it down. The bodies of at least 20 Daesh fighters were found after the fighting and the operations centre said 16 pro-GNA fighters were killed in the battle for Sirte.

More than 50 casual employees at Menengai Oil Refineries in Nakuru claim they have not been paid their salaries and they are subjected to poor working conditions. The aggrieved workers on Wednesday evening downed their tools and held a demonstration demanding settlement of their salary arrears.
Cocoa farmers protested in Asiam near Coaltar in Ayensuano District over alleged attempts to seize their farms to turn them into rubber plantations.

Police arrested a prominent member of newly-formed Gambia Democratic Congress opposition party on charges of conspiracy, obtaining goods by false pretense and theft. She was arrested twice between 28/07 and 08/08.

19 militants and 2 civilians were killed in North Sinai on Wednesday, amid clashes between security forces and militants near a security checkpoint in Sheikh Zuweid. The civilians were in the vicinity of the clashes. Anonymous militants reportedly attacked the security checkpoint of Abu Tawila.

Over 200 students from the Faculty of Agricultural Sciences Institute of Yangambi in Kisangani demanded the rehabilitation of a dormitory they had been housed. The dormitory was burned down in July by University of Kisangani students.

In response to the death of three policemen in clashes with the "Light of the World" sect, the police and military have invaded the village and are attacking followers. 6 people have been reported killed.

Supporters of Inspector General of Police, Gen Kale Kayihura, tried to strom the Makindye Court in Kampala to disrupt the proceedings against the General on charges of torture against civilians that were to take place the following day.

More than 200 residents of Busowa Town Board in Bugiri District protested against poor service delivery and the state of affairs at Busoga Health Centre II.The protest was led by the area local council representative.
A youth was killed in aerial bombardment in Taring village in the Darfur area.
3 farmers were shot dead at Habila in South Kordofan by unidentified gunmen. 2 others were wounded.
JEM, the SPLM-N and a faction of the SLA (Minnawi) signed an AU-brokered roadmap for peace with the government of Sudan in Ethiopia's capital.
2 shops were robbed by members of a paramilitary group led by Mohamed Sayed Ahmed that had been assigned to guard the market.

data.notes: Fighting was reported between SPLA-IO and forces loyal to President Kiir around Lainya county. SPLA-IO forces allegedly repulsed the opposing force. No casualties were reported.

SPLA forces and unidentified armed men clashed in the Kimba Payam of Morobo County. The fight started near a funeral, resulting in fatalities among both the civilians and armed men (coded as 10). The SPLA forces repulsed the attackers.
About 40 female students marched from Fort Hare campus down Oxford Street to challenge attitudes to rape, and to encourage survivors to report the rapes committed against them.

data.notes: A group of women gathered in Cape Town and marched for womens right. The march featured members from Western Cape Religious Leaders Forum, Union of Jewish Women and the International Womens Peace Group.
A block of four classrooms was destroyed in a fire in Vuwani, Limpopo in apparent violent protest.
Suspected al Shabaab threw a grenade at government soldiers in Bakaara Market, killing two, including a soldier.

Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers secured control of a key area near the town of Jowhar known as Madah-Kisi in Southern Somalia, following combat with Al Shabaab fighters on Tuesday. The fighting between SNA and Al Shabaab has led to the deaths and injuries of unspecified number of people.
Al Shabaab attacks a military base in Shalaambood during the overnight hours. Government forces repelled the attack, warring causalities not known - a civilian was injured in the attack.
Boko Haram establishes a base in Bauchi Forest, Burra area.
Participants of a town hall meeting protest food shortage in their area.
Villagers of Ugborodo staged a three days of protests outside a Chevron facility in Escravos to seek better jobs.
Traders protest for two days over the closure of a market.

data.actor2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
data.notes: Gunmen from the Benghazi Defence Brigades (Saraya Bengahzi/BDB) attacked a unit from the Libyan National Army on 9 August at the Naga oilfield, southeast of Zillah. After six hours of clashes, the BDB force, reportedly led by Benghazi militant Ziyad Belam, was forced to withdraw. It is said to have lost six members in the attack while the LNA which was guarding the field, lost two.
People held a protest during the funeral for those killed in Nekemt in the previous protests.
Protesters destroyed a prison in Ginir, freeing all prisoners.
A Lawyer and member of the Lawyers Administrative Council in Port Said claimed that a non-commissioned police officer assaulted him along with two "thugs" in Port Said.

Copts who fled the village of Kom Al-Lufi in Samallout, Minya held a sit-in inside a church to pressure authorities to meet demands related to their legal rights in the aftermath of a sectarian incident in June, rejecting customary reconciliation with the attackers. They also protested the lack of response to their demands for law enforcement and proper compensation for their losses.
A police officer and another four conscripts, in addition to a civilian, were injured in an IED explosion that targeted an armoured police vehicle west of Al-Arish.

An army officer was killed and another three conscripts injured on Tuesday evening when an improvised explosive device (IED) that targeted their armoured vehicle was detonated west of Rafah in North Sinai governorate.
Several properties in the Mvula area of Mitwaba were raided by Mayi Mayi militiamen, who fired shots into the air to scare the villagers away.
Chadian truckers went on strike over new fees. Some Cameroonian truckers also went on strike in support.

data.ally_actor_1: Syntra-Justice: National Union of Justice Workers
data.notes: Judiciary workers went on 72 hour strike nationwide to demand improvements to working conditions.
3 police officers were killed in clashes with followers from the "Light of the World Sect"
A group of young people from Adrar have blocked access to a gas site near Adrar for six days, preventing local workers from accessing or quitting the premises.

data.ally_actor_2: UPND: United Party for National Development
data.notes: A group of men dressed in PF regalia attacked a UPND campaign team in a Lusaka township.
A group of residents from Bousalem staged a peaceful protest against the bad quality of water.
Teachers protested in Gabes on Monday.
Civil society organisations staged a peaceful protest outside the tribunal of Kasserine against rising insecurity.
The Popular Front organised a march in Sidi Bouzid to protest corruption and the restoration of authoritarianism.

data.ally_actor_1: MWUS: Media Workers Union of Swaziland
data.notes: Members of the Media Workers Union of Swaziland have been gathered at the offices of the Swazi Observer to protest low wages, intimidation, and poor working conditions. The High Court has banned an official protest.
Sudanese airforce bombardments were carried out in the Kwele, Barbara and Kourou areas of western Jebel Marra without reports of casualties.
Sudanese airforce bombardments were carried out in the Kwele, Barbara and Kourou areas of western Jebel Marra without reports of casualties.
5 members of a Jebel Marra family were killed in an attack by the Sudanese air force at Kabe near Guldo in the Jebel Marra area.
7 soldiers were killed and 7 others wounded after an ambush of Sudanese military forces by Abbala tribesmen in East Jebel Marra.

At least 3 people were killed in an alleged attempted assassination by unidentified assailants against the governor of Gdudue as his convoy traveled through Yambio. At least 3 of the governor's bodyguards were also injured, while the governor's military escort successfully fought off the attackers.

24 SPLA soldiers and 22 civilians, including the Mayendit county commissioner, were killed and 30 injured in an attack by unidentified gunmen in the Rubkuai area of Mayendit. About 6,000 head of cattle were also taken. The attackers were allegedly from Koch county.
The police again dispersed protesters from Mayville who blockaded the N2. No arrests or violence was reported by police as protesters burnt tyres and blockaded the road.
At Rhodes University in Grahamstown, a group of student activists protest the arrival of Higher Education and Training Deputy Minister Mduduzi Manana and barred him from the institution.

data.ally_actor_1: SACBTA: Southern Africa Cross-Border Traders Association
data.notes: Police broke up a protest, led by the Cross-Border Traders Association, at the Beitbridge border (Musina) post. People are protesting against Zimbabwe limiting imports from South Africa.

At least four Somali government soldiers have been wounded, some critically in double explosions in northern Mogadishu in the early hours on Monday morning. No group has claimed the responsibility for both attacks, but the Al Shabaab militants are known to be carrying out such assaults.
Health workers went on 48 hour strike to demand local recruitment practices.

Scores of persons from a leprosy advocate group took over Emmanuel Uduaghan way (SUMMIT) in Asaba Delta State in protest of the backlog of their stipends and reduction in their daily meals by the state government.
Five persons have been declared missing and a woman is shot and killed after Enwhe and Igbide communities of Isoko South Local Government Area of Delta state clashed over a disputed plot of land.
Suspected NDA militants attacked a group of soldiers, killing three in Nembe LGA. The attackers carted away armaments.

A mob attacked the palace of the Oluwo of Iwo and attempted to set it ablaze after a suspected kidnapper was taken to be housed in the building. Earlier, the mob had attempted to lynch the suspect before a group of civilians took him to the palace.
Traders protest for two days over the closure of a market.

data.ally_actor_1: SCIEGN: Union of Importers, Exporters and Wholesalers of Niger
data.notes: Merchants went on strike to protest tax policies.
Children of the Struggle set the Brakwater Farm where they have been camped alight and then attacked the firefighters who came to douse the flames.
Children of the Struggle set up a barricade on the main Okahandja Road near the Brakwater Farm where they are based. Police dispersed them using rubber bullets and teargas.

RENAMO gunmen attacked the Nacuma administrative post, in Metarica district, Nassa province, setting fire to administrative offices and to the police station, destroying partially the residence of the head of the administrative post, and raiding the health centre. No exchange of gunfire or casualties reported.

data.actor2: Military Forces of the United States
data.notes: US Africa Command (Africom) announced carried out another eight airstrikes on several IS positions in Sirte on 8 August, bringing the total at that point since the beginning of the month to 28.

A 150-man-strong LNA unit arrived some 10 kilometres northeast of Zueitina in Sultan, in a bid to "block" a resumption of oil exports in the region. Lawyers in Mbuji-Maya organized a march to request the lifting of immunity for an MP accused of beating up one of their colleagues.

Chief of Gatete hill, Evrard Rwamigabo, was seriously injured by palm plantation guards.
Three killed, including young children, by a grenade attack.

Fighting took place some 15 kilometres west of Derna, on the coast road towards Ras Hilal along which there is supposed to be a ceasefire. According to Sabra, the mujahideen launched an attack at Wadi Al-Naga on two LNA-linked units based in Ras Hillal and Kirisah. In response, the LNA had sent 40 armed vehicles to the place and were now in control of it.

Eight LNA fighters from 276 Brigade and a volunteer unit were killed and another 19 wounded when the Derna mujahideen launched a surprise attack against them south west of Derna. The bodies of another four who were initially listed among eight missing in the fight were later found by the Red Crescent. They had been summarily shot. Responding to the fighting south west of Derna, the LNA also launched fresh airstrikes against suspected mujahideen positions.

data.notes: An Egyptian air strike killed the head of the Islamic State group along with at least 45 other militants south of Al-Arish. The army's announcement did not say when the operation took place but named the head of the Egyptian affiliate of the group based in the Sinai Peninsula as Abu Doaa al-Ansari. The report could not be confirmed and an Egyptian expert on the Sinai insurgency, said that the military did not provide al-Ansari's real name, which casts doubts on the purported leader's identity and the report of his death. The officials also suggested that the 45 who were mentioned in the military spokesman's statement as killed alongside al-Ansari, may have perished in a series of airstrikes earlier this week that targeted IS positions and ammunition depots near the border town of Rafah.
Over 1000 people who had their homes demolished by the Angolan military protested at the Municipal Administration of Viana.

During demonstrations in Harare, police assaulted journalists who were covering the protests.
Riot police in Zimbabwe used tear gas and water cannon to break up a protest by several hundred demonstrators gathered in Harare in a fresh outbreak of opposition to President Robert Mugabe.
A landmine exploded and injured a soldier in Jebel Semmama.

The Sudanese military withdraw their garrisons from multiple locations inhabited by returned IDPs in east Darfur. The withdrawal of military forces from Muhajiriya, Labado, Khazan Jadeed, Selea, Sani Efendo, Kileikil Mojo, and Kileikil Abu Salama has sparked panic among the returnees.

Police, responding to an incident at at voting station, attempted to disperse a group of people. The group started to attack the police with stones and managed to grab the service pistol from one of the members and assaulted another officer," said Otto.
In Mzinyonke in Ezakheni near Ladysmith, voting was interrupted when residents blockaded the road. Riot police were deployed to manage the situation.

In Chatsworth, a group of residents from the Bottlebrush informal settlement near Croftdene had stoned vehicles passing on the link road from the Higginson Highway in an apparent protest over piped water.

Pensioners protest non-payment of pensions at a government house in Makurdi.
Igbos continue their protest following the murder of a trader in Kano.
Shiites protest for the release of Sheikh Ibrahim El-Zakzaky in Kaduna.

Dozens of journalists held a peaceful sit-in outside the High Constitutional Court to challenge parts of the Communication Code.

After a new head of the locality from a local family was allegedly appointed in Ngwa, in the Kongolo area of Tanganyika, the situation was disputed by another family and a brawl broke out, which included the use of machetes. Many people were wounded and houses were destroyed. The two families have been in competition for power in the area for months.

King Iyerite Chiefson Awululu, the paramount ruler of Oluasiri community in Nembe Local Government Area in Bayelsa State, narrowly escaped death on Sunday July 31st after he was attacked by armed men who invaded his residence, cut him mercilessly with machete and left him for dead.

data.notes: The forces of Operation Solid Structure seized Al-Dollar residential area in Sirte following two days of fighting. Three of its members were killed and 16 others injured in the fighting on 31 July.
The Ras Lanuf, Sidra and Zuetina oil terminals would reopen without conditions after the Petroleum Facilities Guards (PFG) lifted the oil blockade.
Police allegedly beat and used tear gas on a civilian in Darsaw Town, in the context of an operation to prevent witchcraft activities in Rivercess county.

data.source: Oromiya Media Network; Ethiomedia; Agence France Presse -- English
data.notes: Tens of thousands of Amhara people protested in Gonder against government domination, calling for the release of members of the Welkait committee as well as denouncing ongoing killings in the Oromia region.

People protested against the government agenda in Tijo-Waqantera in Gadab Asasa district, West Arsi, destroying government offices and burning down the homes of government officials. At least one soldier was reportedly killed and another wounded in clashes between the two groups.

Three prisoners announced in a statement on Sunday that they are starting an open-ended hunger strike to object the court's rule of imprisonment in their case, as well as others who refused the maritime demarcation deal with Saudi Arabia.

Residents of the village of Mazloum reacted angrily to the use of police force, mobbing and taking captive the policeman who had used a firearm. Central Security Forces were dispatched to the village to restore order and free the policeman. Villagers hurled stones at the police, who responded by firing teargas to subdue the violence.

One citizen was killed, and two others injured by police in Mazloum village, Daqahliya province, in an attempted arrest that turned into a deathly clash between police and villagers. Police forces stormed a house in the village to carry out the arrest of a male suspect when the suspect's family interfered, refusing to turn him in and attempting to help him escape. A violent confrontation arose during which an officer opened fire.
On Sunday, a police officer was shot dead by unknown militants near a police station in Arish city of restive North Sinai province.

Arms caches containing projectiles and explosive-making tools were destroyed by detachments of the People's National Army in the provinces of Tizi Ouzou and Skikda on Sunday. Army detachments discovered and destroyed, in Azazga, in the province Tizi Ouzou (1st Military Region) and Skikda (5th Military Region) on 31 July 2016, arms caches containing two mines, a bomb, four homemade projectiles, a mortar shell, a grenade, a power generator and explosive-making tools.
